page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN CULLOMPTON
page.content: Since the closing of the railway station in the 1960s people in Cullompton have had to rely on buses,taxis and private cars.The buses run every hour during the day to and from{Exeter}and some buses go through to{Tiverton.}It costs Â£1.30 to go to Exeter.If people wish to travel by train they usually go to Exeter.Inter_city trains between{ {Bristol}and{Penzance}stop there.Trains to{London}go every hour.It takes 2 1/2 hours and costs Â£19.30. Motorway access has helped transport firms.A Mr.Heard has run his business for 30 years.He has 12 lorries and employs 14 people carrying animal feed.He thinks his company will expand,as will other similar haulage firms in Cullompton.
